sn56.48:1.1: “Mendicants, suppose the earth was entirely covered with water.
sn56.48:1.2: And a person threw a yoke with a single hole into it.
sn56.48:1.3: The east wind wafts it west; the west wind wafts it east; the north wind wafts it south; and the south wind wafts it north.
sn56.48:1.4: And there was a one-eyed turtle who popped up once every hundred years.
sn56.48:1.6: Would that one-eyed turtle, popping up once every hundred years, still poke its neck through the hole in that yoke?”
sn56.48:2.1: “That’s how unlikely it is to get reborn as a human being.
sn56.48:2.2: And that’s how unlikely it is for a Realized One to arise in the world, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
sn56.48:2.3: And that’s how unlikely it is for the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One to shine in the world.
sn56.48:2.4: And now, mendicants, you have been reborn as a human being. A Realized One has arisen in the world, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha. And the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One shines in the world.
sn56.48:3.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
